scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The John Farnsworth Hammond, Jr. photograph album and other material dates from 1899 to 1939, with the bulk of material dating from 1913 to 1915, and contains 98 items. The album consists of photographic prints and cyanotypes that document sewer construction projects in Brooklyn, Rochester, and Oswego, N.Y., as well as Mifflinburg, PA. Sewer construction photographs show street-level views, laborers, excavations, sewer pipes, dams, and construction equipment such as steam engines and horse-drawn tractors. Brooklyn photographs in the album originate in and around the Gowanus Canal, including the neighborhoods of Gowanus, Cobble Hill, and Carroll Gardens. Photographs in the album were taken by John Farnsworth Hammond, Jr., a contractor associated with the sewer construction projects, and V. Mayhew. Most construction scenes are identified by street name or neighborhood with a description of the image; photographs taken by V. Mayhew are labeled. The album also contains portraits of the John Farnsworth Hammond, Sr. family and rural scenes near their home in Newport, RI.

In addition to the photograph album, the collection includes a pamphlet titled "Table of Circles from Trautwine's Civil Engineer's Pocket-Book," and two newspaper clippings--an obituary for a sanitary engineer, and a photograph of a horse-drawn plough.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of Brooklyn images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Based on the collection's date span and the date of death of the primary creator, all photographic items in the collection will enter the public domain by 2038. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.
